In mathematics, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of two or more integers, when 
at least one of them is not zero, is the largest positive integer that divides the 
numbers without a remainder. For example, the GCD of 8 and 12 is 4. The 
greatest common divisor is also known as the greatest common factor ... What is 
the greatest common divisor of 54 and 24?
